profile.name: dan
profile.bio: 👨‍💻 Go + React dev, dabbling in AI. Always building, always learning. Sharing thoughts on code, tech, & the future. Let's talk systems! 🚀

tweets.content: Stuck on a tricky async/await issue in JS. Promises are fun until they're not. Time to grab more coffee and consult the docs (again). ☕ #javascript #async
Discovered a neat little open-source tool for visualizing dependencies in my project. Might even contribute a small bug fix if I get some free time this weekend. #opensource #devtools
Had a really productive pairing session today. Solved a tricky performance bottleneck that had been nagging us for a while. Love those 'aha!' moments with colleagues. ✨ #softwaredevelopment
Been tinkering with a small CLI tool in Rust to manage my dotfiles. Learning so much about memory management and borrowing. Rustaceans, any recommended beginner crates for CLI parsing? #rustlang #cli
Dynamic typing is great for rapid prototyping, but static typing makes refactoring a joy and catches so many errors early. I swing back and forth on this daily. #typesafety #programming
Unpopular opinion: Writing good tests is often more satisfying than shipping the feature itself. Catches errors, ensures reliability, pure chef's kiss. 🧪 #devlife #testing
That moment when you deploy to production on a Friday afternoon and immediately question all your life choices. Wish me luck. 🤞 #deployment #devops #fridayfeeling
Really enjoying diving into Domain-Driven Design principles for our new project. It feels like it forces a much clearer understanding of the business logic early on. #DDD #softwarearchitecture
Read an interesting article on new CSS container queries. Looks incredibly powerful for responsive design, but also a potential minefield. Exciting times for frontend! #frontend #css
Huge shoutout to the maintainers of @shadcn for their amazing UI components! Their documentation and flexibility saved me so much time today. Good docs are a blessing. 🙏 #opensource #react
Currently exploring serverless functions with AWS Lambda. The abstraction is great, but figuring out state management across invocations is a whole new puzzle. Any pro tips? #cloud #serverless
My git commit messages usually start strong, then devolve into 'fix stuff' and 'more fixes'. Anyone else? Or is it just me? 😅 #git #devhumor

Attended a great webinar on accessibility best practices today. So important to remember our users and build inclusive experiences from the start. A good reminder for every project. #a11y #webdevelopment
Experimenting with Docker Compose for local dev environments. So much cleaner than managing multiple services manually. Why didn't I do this sooner? #docker #devops
Just read about the latest security vulnerability in [popular library]. Reminder to always keep your dependencies updated! It's not just about getting new features. #infosec #dependencies
Microservices have their place, but a well-designed monolith can often be simpler, faster to develop, and easier to operate for many teams. Change my mind. #architecture #softwareengineering
Diving into WebAssembly this week. The performance potential for certain applications is absolutely wild. Any favorite starter projects or resources for Wasm beginners? #webdev #wasm
Hot take: Low-code/no-code tools are not a threat to developers, they're an accelerant. They free us up to solve harder, more interesting problems. The future is hybrid. #futureofdev #nocode
Just spent an hour debugging a 'bug' that turned out to be a misplaced semicolon. My brain is officially soup. 🫠 #programming #devhumor
My favorite part of debugging is adding console.logs, then removing them, then adding them again in slightly different places. It's a journey, not a destination. #debugging #programming
